name: BMC Remedy
description: This app supports ticket management functions on incidents in BMC Remedy.

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied credentials

actions.verbose:
Typically the following parameters are required, but this can be configured, therefore the action defines all parameters as optional and relies on the installation to validate the required parameters:
  • first_name
  • last_name
  • description
  • reported_source
  • service_type
If field value is provided individually as well as in fields parameter, then value in fields parameter will be used for creating the incident. For example, to create an incident using fields parameter and assign it to an assignee named Mary, set the fields parameter to {"First_Name": "Customer First Name", "Last_Name": "Customer Last Name", "Description": "Incident Description", "Service_Type": "User Service Restoration", "Reported Source": "Direct Input", "Status": "Assigned", "Assignee Login ID": "Mary", "Assignee": "Mary Mann"}
To add comment set fields parameter to {"Work Log Type": "General Information", "Detailed Description": "Comment to add"}.
To create an incident, first_name and last_name are those of the customer that exists in the system.
The vault_id parameter takes the vault ID of a file and attaches it to the incident.
The attachment should be placed in vault of the container from which the action will be executed, and it would appear in Work Detail section on BMC Remedy.
Typical (default installation) values for impact are:
  • 1-Extensive/Widespread
  • 2-Significant/Large
  • 3-Moderate/Limited
  • 4-Minor/Localized
Typical (default installation) values for urgency are:
  • 1-Critical
  • 2-High
  • 3-Medium
  • 4-Low
Typical (default installation) values for status are:
  • New
  • Assigned
  • In Progress
  • Pending
  • Resolved
  • Closed
  • Cancelled
Typical (default installation) values for reported_source are:
  • Direct Input
  • Email
  • External Escalation
  • Fax
  • Self Service
  • Systems Management
  • Phone
  • Voice Mail
  • Walk In
  • Web
  • Other
  • BMC Impact Manager Event
Typical (default installation) values for service_type are:
  • User Service Restoration
  • User Service Request
  • Infrastructure Restoration
  • Infrastructure Event
Typical (default installation) values for work_info_type are:
  • Customer Inbound:
    • Customer Communication
    • Customer Follow-up
    • Customer Status Update
  • Customer Outbound
    • Closure Follow Up
    • Detail Clarification
    • General Information
    • Resolution Communications
    • Satisfaction Survey
    • Status Update
  • General
    • Incident Task / Action
    • Problem Script
    • Working Log
    • Email System
    • Paging System
    • BMC Impact Manager Update
    • Chat
  • Vendor
    • Vendor Communication
Typical (default installation) values of status_reason for a given status are:
  • Pending
    • Automated Resolution Reported
    • Client Action Required
    • Client Hold
    • Future Enhancement
    • Infrastructure Change
    • Local Site Action Required
    • Monitoring Incident
    • Purchase Order Approval
    • Registration Approval
    • Request
    • Supplier Delivery
    • Support Contact Hold
    • Third Party Vendor Action Reqd
  • Resolved
    • Automated Resolution Reported
    • Customer Follow-Up Required
    • Future Enhancement
    • Monitoring Incident
    • No Further Action Required
    • Temporary Corrective Action
  • Closed
    • Automated Resolution Reported
    • Infrastructure Change Created
  • Cancelled
    • No longer a Causal CI

This action can be used to assign an incident to a user. Use the fields parameter to set the Status, Assignee Login ID and Assignee values. For example: To assign an incident to the user Mary set the fields parameter to {"Status": "Assigned", "Assignee Login ID": "Mary", "Assignee": "Mary Mann"}
To add comment set fields parameter to {"Work Log Type": "General Information", "Detailed Description": "Comment to add"}.
The attachment should be placed in vault of the container from which the action will be executed, and it would appear in Work Detail section on BMC Remedy.
Typical (default installation) values for work_info_type are:
  • Customer Inbound:
    • Customer Communication
    • Customer Follow-up
    • Customer Status Update
  • Customer Outbound
    • Closure Follow Up
    • Detail Clarification
    • General Information
    • Resolution Communications
    • Satisfaction Survey
    • Status Update
  • General
    • Incident Task / Action
    • Problem Script
    • Working Log
    • Email System
    • Paging System
    • BMC Impact Manager Update
    • Chat
  • Vendor
    • Vendor Communication

The action supports limiting the number of incidents returned using the limit parameter. The input should be a positive integer. The results are always sorted in descending order based on their last modified date to place the latest modified incidents at the top. For example to get the latest 10 incidents that matched the filter, specify the limit as 10. If limit is zero or not specified, then all incidents will be returned.

To define a set of criteria to filter incidents, query must be provided in query parameter.
Query must contain field label enclosed in single quotation marks(''), and non-numeric values in double quotation marks("").
Eg: 'Incident Number'="INC000000000001", 'Submit Date'="February 20, 2017"
If a field name contains single quotation mark, add another single quotation mark next to it.
Eg: If field name is Submitter's Phone Number, query must contain field label as 'Submitter''s Phone Number'
More information about using fields in query parameter can be found on Fields in query.
Query can accept various operators such as:

  1. Relational and Logical Operators:
    • Relational and Logical operators are useful especially in non-text fields (such as date and time fields) when you want to search for a value within a numerical range.
    • Some of the examples are as follows:
      ('Submitter'="admin") AND (NOT 'Incident Number'="INC000000000001")
      'Impact'="1-Extensive/Widespread" OR 'Urgency'="1-Critical"
      'Incident Number' = "INC000000000001"
      'Status' != "Closed"
      'Submit Date' > "February 28, 2017"
    • More information about relational and logical operators can be found at Relational and logical Operators link.
  2. Keywords in query:
    • Keywords can be used anywhere where character values are accepted.
    • Most commonly used keywords are: $DATE$, $NULL$, $TIME$, $TIMESTAMP$, $USER$, and $WEEKDAY$.
    • Some of the examples are as follows:
      'Assignee' = $NULL$
      'Create date' < ($TIMESTAMP$ - 24*60*60)
    • More information about Keywords can be found at Keywords link.
  3. Wildcard symbols:
    • Wildcard symbols can be used to indicate one or more characters.
    • Wildcard symbols that can be used in query are: %, _, -, [], [^]
    • Some of the examples are as follows:
      'Submitter' LIKE "*Bob%ton*"
      'Phone Number' LIKE "_ 212 5555454 (66)"
    • More information about wildcard symbols can be found at Wildcard symbols link.
More information about BMC Remedy Query Syntax can be found at Query Syntax link.

limit.description: Maximum number of incidents to return

actions.description: Add work log information to the incident
